text: The <extra_id_0> class II trans- activator <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is the main transcriptional co-activator for the expression of MHC class II proteins .
Its N-terminal 125 amino acids function as an independent transcriptional activation domain .
Analyses of the primary amino acid sequence of the activation domain predict the presence of three alpha-helices , each with a high proportion of acidic residues .
Using site - directed mutagenesis , we found that two of these predicted alpha-helices are required for full transcriptional activation by <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Moreover , a <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein in which both functional alpha-helices have been deleted displays a dominant negative phenotype .

text: This activation domain of <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> interacts with the 32 kDa subunit of the general transcription complex TFIID , <extra_id_0> TAFII32 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: We conclude that interactions between <extra_id_0> TAFII32 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are responsible for activation of class II genes .
